awd_titl_txt: CS For All: RPP: A Scalable RPP for Preparing and Supporting Teachers to Teach Culturally Responsive and Rigorous CS Courses  in SC High Schools
awd_abstract_narration:
Clemson University is broadening participation in computing in South Carolina by preparing computer science (CS) teachers to effectively use culturally responsive, inclusive pedagogies. The South Carolina Department of Education (SCDE) has just launched K-8 Standards that aim to engage all students in computer science and computational thinking and create a pipeline for high school courses.  These inaugural standards present a significant need for qualified teachers and the knowledge to prepare them. This proposal would develop an active community of high school CS teachers and researchers ahead of this demand.

The project leverages an existing Researcher-Practitioner Partnership (RPP), including computer science and education researchers, along with administrators and teacher practitioners from the Anderson Five Career Campus (which will offer computing courses to high school students in Anderson School Districts), Pickens County School District, and South Carolina's Coalition for Mathematics and Science (an organization providing professional develoment to additional districts). Many of the participating schools have significant underrepresented and/or economically disadvantaged student populations. The project will investigate the effectiveness of different models of teacher support (including just-in-time, online only, versus a mixture of online and offline) on Pedagogical Content Knowledge for Computer Science, self-efficacy, and teacher understanding and implementation of culturally responsive computing, and teacher belief that all students are capable of digital innovation. There has been strong coordination between project activities and policy that is being adopted by the SCDE, which could serve as a model for partnerships in other states.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

pgm_ref.pgm_ref_txt: Computer Science for All (CS for All)
EXP PROG TO STIM COMP RES
REU SUPP-Res Exp for Ugrd Supp

por.por_cntn:
Through rigorous educational research in computer science teaching and learning, resulting in several publications and presentations, this project has contributed to understandings of culturally responsive computer science education. The intellectual merit of this project consists of contributions to the ways in which computer science middle and high school teachers respond to and implement culturally responsive approaches to instruction. Additionally, our project has contributed to our understandings of the types of year-round professional support teachers prefer and utlize as they implement computer science instruction in middle and high schools.

Broader impacts of this award include the hundreds to thousands of students now being taught by teachers with deepened preparation to teach culturally responsive computer science. This project supported nearly 70 teachers to participate in one or more of three cohorts of professional development opportunities and is likely to continue to support teachers with culturally responsive professional development as we transition from grant-related sources of funding. 

Additionally, this project supported several doctoral students in education as well as in computer science. During the course of weekly project team meetings, members of the project research team (all of the PIs and all of the doctoral students) would expand and deepen their understandings of rigorous processes for conducting educational research, as well as the specific computer science content relevant and important for the project professional development activities.


Last Modified: 02/14/2022
Modified by: Stacy M Che
